ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Conceptions of gender, writing skills, introduction to queer literature, understanding of masculine studies

I gained a greater knowledge on gender studies and views on masculinity in the world. I improved my writing ability and argument structure. I was able to compare my views with other people in the class and those of the articles we read.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Thought content was very thought provoking. A lot of the material was really fresh because it doesn't appear in most other subjects. Class discussion was also eye-opening.

Sometimes the readings are quite dense and difficult to understand if you don't have prior knowledge to gender theory or political science theory. Perhaps maybe going through a brief discussion to unpack some tougher readings before launching into discussion

One strength of the course was the professor and TA. The professor was very engaging and provided interesting ways for us to interact with the material, such as online class discussions and relevant essay topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This class is so enjoyable. Definitely take it if you can. This content is so cool and not discussed in other parts of schoolwork. You gain so much perspective and everything you learn about and discuss in class is super thought-provoking.
Its an incredible course to take in gender studies!
Absolutely. This is a course everyone should take.

I would recommend this class to another student because it was very informative for anyone looking to gain an understanding of gender or culture. The class was well organized and facilitated engaging conversation.

extras.title:
WGSS S304 01/ANTH S250 01
        Men, Manhood, and Masculinity
